trans-unit.source: Light object that projects its effect in a cone-shaped area along a specified direction.
SpotLight is a kind of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PointLight>, since it has a position, range, and attenuation.
However, SpotLight also allows you to control the direction, shape, and other properties of the cone of the light's effect.

Specify values for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.OuterConeAngle%2A> (beyond which nothing is illuminated), and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.InnerConeAngle%2A> (within which everything is fully illuminated) to change the spotlighting effect.
Lighting between the outside of the inner cone and the outer cone falls off linearly.
![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram")
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref> class using the specified color, position, direction, and cone angles.
Diffuse color of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>.
Position of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>.
Direction of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>.
Angle that defines a cone outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.
Angle that defines a cone within which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the direction in which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref> projects its light.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the direction of the Spotlight's projection.
The default value is `0,0,-1`.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.Direction*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>'s cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.

The intensity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight>'s illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the InnerConeAngle and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.OuterConeAngle%2A>.
![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram") ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>'s cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.
The default value is `180`.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.InnerConeAngle*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>'s cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.

The intensity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight>'s illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.InnerConeAngle%2A> and the OuterConeAngle.
The light provides no illumination outside the angle specified by this property.
![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram") ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight"></xref>'s cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.
The default value is `90`.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.OuterConeAngle*> dependency property.
To be added.
